instructor.name: Mark Brown
instructor.title: Adjunct Professor of Statistics, Columbia University

office_hours.note: Semi-retired, no Columbia office. Will post time/place on CourseWorks.

teaching_assistant.note: Contact information will be provided on CourseWorks

course_objectives: To familiarize students with models, methodology, and applications of stochastic processes. Relevant to statistics, biostatistics, financial mathematics, actuarial science, computer science, electrical engineering, operations research, and management science.

prerequisites.required: Probability course at level of W4203, good knowledge of calculus

textbook.title: Introduction to Probability Models
textbook.author: Sheldon M. Ross
textbook.note: Many discount sellers online for new and used copies

grading.curve_policy: Statistical adjustment (curve) may be applied to midterm and/or final if appropriate

covered_chapters.topic: Discrete time countable state Markov chains
Continuous time countable state Markov chains
Aspects of stochastic calculus and option pricing

not_systematically_covered.note: May present applications from time to time to illustrate methodology

posted_in_advance: Problems and solutions (from time to time)
course_materials.recommendation: Read posted lectures before class for better engagement and two-way discussion
course_materials.homework_support: Zoom homework review sessions before each assignment due, videos posted on CourseWorks

policies.honor_code: All students must adhere to honor code at http://www.barnard.edu/
policies.zoom_sessions: Used for homework review sessions (large classrooms difficult to reserve)
